intro: Acrostichum costatum var. deltigerum, commonly known as the broad-leafed fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery fronds that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread and form dense clumps. Its leaves are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, with a distinctive, broad outline that gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
